meanings.definition: Restless tossing and turning in bed.
meanings.sent1: After drinking too much soda, the boy's jactitations kept him awake all night.
meanings.sent2: The baby's jactitations in her crib indicated she was having trouble falling asleep.
meanings.sent3: During the sleepover, Sarah's jactitations made her friends giggle.
meanings.sent4: The jactitations of the restless sea mirrored the boy's tossing in bed.
meanings.sent5: The jactitations of the dog dreaming on the floor were adorable to watch.

meanings.definition: Involuntary twitching or jerking of the body.
meanings.sent1: The patient's jactitations were a side effect of the medication.
meanings.sent2: His jactitations were so severe that he couldn't sit still for a minute.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about his jactitations during the stand-up show.
meanings.sent4: The jactitations of the old car's engine made it sound like it was alive.
meanings.sent5: The jactitations of the tree branches in the wind created a mesmerizing dance.

meanings.definition: Boastful or exaggerated speech or behavior.
meanings.sent1: His jactitations about his accomplishments annoyed his classmates.
meanings.sent2: The politician's jactitations during the speech raised doubts about his honesty.
meanings.sent3: The jactitations of the little boy pretending to be a superhero were endearing.
meanings.sent4: Her jactitations of being the best singer in town were met with skepticism.
meanings.sent5: The jactitations of the peacock showing off its feathers were truly impressive.
